top_categories.workout_context: 56ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Alentejo Gravel's Alentejo rolling, Portuguese gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 80 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Alentejo Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Alentejo Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 80, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Alentejo Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on alentejo rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Alentejo Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 80 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,500ft of climbing on alentejo rolling gravel does to your power file on race day.
Varied gradients on alentejo rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on alentejo rolling gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Alentejo Gravel’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Alentejo Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on alentejo rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: alentejo rolling, portuguese gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 80 miles of alentejo rolling gravel in Alentejo, Portugal.
